newsitem.title: CHINA: China to enable mobile phones on underground.
newsitem.headline: China to enable mobile phones on underground.

text.p: China has upgraded its communications system to enable use of mobile telephones on Beijing's underground railway system, an official of the Beijing Telecom Administration Bureau said on Monday.
About 230,000 mobile telephone users would be able to use their phones by the end of the month on the underground, the official said.
The bureau and the Beijing Subway Corporation have set up dozens of cellular telephone stations to handle signals underground, he said without giving further details.
China said it had 6.2 million registered mobile telephone users at the end of last year, and the number is expected to reach 10 million in 1997 and 20 million by 2000.
